intro: Hibiscus muhamedis, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces蒴果 (capsular fruits) that contain numerous seeds. Hibiscus muhamedis thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various climates.
